text.section:
A guaranty under this section may be:
A separate guaranty that specifically designates the product, fabric, or related material; or
A continuing guaranty that:
Is given by a seller to a buyer;
Applies to any product, fabric, or related material sold to the buyer; and
Is in the form the Department approves.
A person may not manufacture, sell, or hold with intent to sell any new or unused product that does not comply with the flammability requirements of this subtitle.
A person may not give a false guaranty.

This section does not apply to a person who:
Receives in good faith a product, fabric, or related material that is covered by a guaranty that is signed by and contains the name and address of the person who manufactured the product, fabric, or related material or from whom it was received;
Has not altered the flammability of the product, fabric, or related material covered by the guaranty; and
Reasonably and in good faith relies on the guaranty.
